questions.question: What is the primary focus of inclusive education?

options.text: Ensuring that all children, regardless of background, have access to quality education

questions.explanation: The primary focus of inclusive education is ensuring that all children, regardless of background, have access to quality education.

questions.question: Which group is most likely to face barriers to accessing education?
questions.explanation: Girls in rural areas are most likely to face barriers to accessing education.

questions.question: What is a key policy approach to promoting inclusive education for students with disabilities?

options.text: Providing special education teachers and resources in mainstream schools
Limiting their access to formal education
Placing all students in separate schools

questions.explanation: A key policy approach to promoting inclusive education for students with disabilities is providing special education teachers and resources in mainstream schools.

questions.question: Which of the following can help improve access to education for refugees?

options.text: Reducing the number of schools available
Offering education programs in refugee camps
Excluding them from local education systems
Limiting their access to basic education

questions.explanation: Offering education programs in refugee camps can help improve access to education for refugees.

questions.question: Which international organization works extensively on promoting inclusive education globally?

options.text: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

questions.explanation: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) works extensively on promoting inclusive education globally.
